string.value: Just Another Day at Work
I found Roly-Poly 9 working hard, so I took a picture of him with the camera that #p2040015# gave me.
I found Roly-Poly 10 at the 3rd floor of Eos Tower working hard, so I took a picture of him with the camera that #p2040015# gave me.

string.name: name
string.value: Roly-Poly 10

string.name: parent
string.value: Just Another Day at Work
I found the last Roly-Poly working hard, so I took a picture of him with the camera that #p2040015# gave me.
I took the pictures of all 10 roly-polys working at Eos Tower and gave them to #p2040015# of the Toy Factory in Ludibrium. It looks like Roly-Poly 6 is in need of help... I should check him out.

string.name: name
string.value: The Drumming Bunny
I should go see Roly-Poly Worker 5 at Eos Tower

I met up with Roly-Poly Worker 5 again at Eos Tower. He was complaining about the Drumming Bunnies that seem to be bothering him at the 60th floor, and requested that I collect #b100 Toy Drums#k for him. If I get this for him, then there may be more work in store...\n\n#t4000127# #b#c4000127##k/100

Just the way the Roly-Poly Worker 5 asked, I took out the drumming bunnies and collected the toy drums. He said his work got easier when I'm around, and he wants me to help him out on some other stuff. Maybe I should chill here and help these guys out for a change.

string.name: name
string.value: Eliminating the Drumming Bunny
I should go see Roly-Poly Worker 5 at Eos Tower

I met up with Roly-Poly Worker 5 again at Eos Tower. He thanked me for helping him out last time, and mentioned that I should have heard it from General Maester, but we'll have to take away the force of darkness and put it back to the way it used to be. He requested that I eliminate the Drumming Bunnies at the 60th floor of Eos Tower and collect #b1000 Toy Drums#k for him. \n\n#t4000127# #b#c4000127##k/1000

Just the way the Roly-Poly Worker 5 asked, I took out the drumming bunnies and collected the toy drums. I think this really took out the wild bunnies as well as taking away the force of darkness. Here's hoping that those bunnies turn back to the old, adorable bunnies they used to be.

string.name: name
string.value: Roly-Poly 6's Tool
I should go check out Roly-Poly 6 at Eos Tower
I met up with Roly-Poly 6 at Eos Tower. He wanted me to find a tool that he lost right where a ton of monsters are. I have a feeling #bBloctopus#k might have taken it...
I found the lost tool for Roly-Poly 6. I'm hoping this will allow him to fix things at Eos Tower now.

string.name: name
string.value: Helping Fix Eos Tower
I should go check out Roly-Poly 8 at Eos Tower

I met up with Roly-Poly 8 again at Eos Tower. He seemed worried that there's a lot of places to fix at Eos Tower, only to have the monsters stop him from doing so. He asked if I could take out #b25 #o3230103#es#k and collect #b20 Plastic Crowns#k in the process. I can do this... 

#o3230103# #r#a32241##k
#t4000100# #b#c4000100##k/20

I took out a bunch of #o3230103#s and collected #c4000100#s just the way the Roly-Poly 8 of Eos Tower asked. How long is this maintenance job going to last anyway? This should get done soon so I don't have to do them any more favors.

string.name: name
string.value: Fixing Eos Tower
I should go check out Roly-Poly 10 at Eos Tower.

I met up with Roly-Poly 10 again at Eos Tower. He asked if I could get him #b30 Yellow Toy Blocks#k and #b15 Blue Toy Blocks#k to fix the tower. I think I can get those by taking out the Block Golems...

#t4000101# #b#c4000101##k/30
#t4000102# #b#c4000102##k/15
I gave Roly-Poly 10 the yellow blocks and blue blocks needed to fix this place up. A toy block used to fix a castle...where else can this happen but here in Ludibrium?

string.name: name
string.value: The Girl Who Lost Her Memory

string.name: parent
string.value: Korin's Memory
I heard something happened to Korin of Ludibrium... I better go check up on her.

I met a girl named #bKorin#k at a small house nearby Ludibrium. Korin had been missing for 10 months, and she did not remember anything that occurred during that time. She wanted me to find these men wearing the black suit that visited her the other day, and ask him whatever happened to her the last 10 months. A man wearing black suit... I don't think he'd be at Ludibrium nor Eos Tower.

I met Korin, who was suffering from partial loss of memory, at Ludibrium. I was able to meet Agent Marco at the Omega Sector. He's the man wearing the black suit who held the clue regarding her lost memory.

string.name: name
string.value: The Man in the Black Suit

string.name: parent
string.value: Korin's Memory

I met #bAgent Marco#k at the Omega Sector. I asked him some questions regarding Korin, and I was able to find out that she had been kidnapped by a group of aliens that invaded the Omega Sector. He also said that in order to recover Korin's lost memories, I'll have to defeat the #bMateons#k and collect #b5 Memory Pieces#k that contain her lost memories... I'll have to head over to the Boswell Field quickly.\n\n#t4031090# #b#c4031090##k/5
I defeated the aliens that took Korin's memories, gathered up the memory pieces, and gave them to Agent Marco. He then put the pieces together and made it into one whole piece.

string.name: name
string.value: The Recovered Memory

string.name: parent
string.value: Korin's Memory

After defeating a bunch of #bMateons#k at the Boswell Field, I went through their stuff and found 5 #bMemory Pieces#k that contained Korin's lost memories. I gave them to Agent Marco, and he proceeded to put the 5 together into one whole piece of #bKorin's Memory#k. Now all I have left to do is give this piece of memory back to Korin.

I gave Korin her lost memories through the man in Omega Sector wearing black suits, #bAgent Marco#k. She was initially disoriented after recovering her memories, but she promised to fully enjoy life the way she used to before the kidnapping. Hopefully that'll never happen again.

string.name: name
string.value: Toy Soldier's Walnut
I should go see Delv the Toy Soldier, who's at Eos Tower.

Delv the Toy Soldier, firmly protecting the gates of the 100th floor on Eos Tower, asked me for a favor by getting him #b20 tasty walnuts#k as a way to fight the boredom of guarding the gate and doing little else. He said a black rat monster called #bDirty Ratz#k might offer up the walnuts...\n\n#t4031093# #b#c4031093##k/20

I got Delv the Toy Soldier, firmly protecting the gates of the 100th floor on Eos Tower, the #b20 tasty walnuts#k he requested as a way to fight the boredom of guarding the gate and doing little else. He was very thankful and asked if I could go talk to his buddy Olson next to him if I have some free time to burn.
I should go see Olson the Toy Soldier, who's at Eos Tower

I ran into Olson the Toy Soldier at the 100th floor on Eos Tower, doing his job as the security guard next to Delv. Olson told me a story of a monster sneaking in through the cracks of time and stealing a pendulum from the clocktower, culminating with the monster disguising itself as a dollhouse somewhere inside. I need to locate the one that's different from the sea of dollhouses in here.

Inside the secret room of Eos Tower, I located the monster disguised as a dollhouse, destroyed it, recovered the pendulum, and gave it to Mark the Toy Soldier. This should get the Ludibrium Clocktower to start working again.

string.name: name
string.value: The Broken Clocktower

string.name: parent
string.value: A Delivery to a Lost Time
I should go see Olson the Toy Soldier, who's at Eos Tower

Olson the Toy Soldier from the 100th floor of Eos Tower wanted me to get the #b#t4031094##k obtained from the monster disguised as the dollhouse to #p2040029# at the Lost Time somewhere inside the Clocktower. Apparently the #p2040029# should be able to fix him.
I found Grandpa Clock standing around somewhere in the lost time, but he looks very lethargic, as if he's about to stop.

string.name: name
string.value: Grandpa Clock's Crisis

string.name: parent
string.value: A Delivery to a Lost Time

After obtaining the #b#t4031094##k by destroying the dollhouse the monster disguised as, I went down to the Lost Time to find #p2040029#. But it seemed like instead of him helping me fix the clocktower, he was about to die first, so he wanted me to take down some monsters called #bTick-Tock#k and pick up the #b#t4031098##k that they possess. I better get them before #p2040029# dies.
I got the #t4031098# from Tick Tock. I need to get this to the #p2040029# before it's too late.

string.name: name
string.value: Delivering the #t4031094#

string.name: parent
string.value: A Delivery to a Lost Time

At the Lost Time in the Ludibrium Clocktower, I gave #p2040029# the #b#t4031098##k from Tick-Tock's. I'm glad I got to give this to him before too late. Now I should wait to hear a word from #bOlson#k.

At the Lost Time in the Ludibrium Clocktower, I gave #p2040029# the #b#t4031094##k, an essential part of the clocktower. Now all I have to do is wait for the #p2040029# to fix the clocktower. Will this work?

string.name: name
string.value: The Clocktower Headache
I should check on #p2040029#, who is working hard at the Lost Time.

Deep in the Lost Time of Ludibrium, I met up with #p2040029#. He seemed to be annoyed by the fact that the tiny Ticks have been going inside the clocktower and destroy parts of it, making his job much harder than it should have been. For the sake of #p2040029#, I'll need to take out #b80 Ticks#k. \n\n#o3210207# #r#a32341#

I took care of the request #p2040029# made, by taking out the #bTicks#k. The Ticks were another one of the reasons the clocktower seemed to have something wrong at all times, so this should give #p2040029# a good night's sleep.

string.name: name
string.value: The Clock Workers' Batteries
I should check on #p2040029#, who is working hard at the Lost Time.

I met up with #p2040029# deep inside the abandoned time of Ludibrium. #p2040029# admitted since he's an old fella, the spring was needed to rewind himself back to life, but the younger clock workers these days are all battery-operated, only to have some of them not have adequate batteries and thus not working the way it should be. I should collect #b200 cheap batteries#k for the sake of those clocks in need of them. \n\n#t4000111# #b#c4000111##k/200

I got the cheap batteries needed for the new battery-operated worker clocks. #p2040029# seemed ecstatic over the prospect of those workers finally showing life and lessening his work burden in the process. Anyway, what exactly are they doing in there...?

string.name: name
string.value: Assembling a Toy
I should go see #p2041018# at Toy Factory.

I ran into #bHans#k, the toy assembler at the Toy Factory in Ludibrium. He made a proposal where if I get him some parts for a toy, then he'll assemble it and make something fun out of it. This is sweet! The things I'll need are #b20 cheap batteries from the Robo, 20 metal hearts of Master Robo, and 30 cogs of Chronos#k. 

#t4000111# #b#c4000111##k/20
#t4000112# #b#c4000112##k/20
#t4000115# #b#c4000115##k/30

At the toy factory in Ludibrium, I gave Hans the parts needed to assemble a toy. Hans put together the parts and made a very unique sack out of it. He said he put some toys inside, but... I don't know, something may pop up that'll scare the daylight out of me. I better be careful with it...

string.name: name
string.value: Rocky's Parts
I better go talk to #p2041019#

I met up with #p2041019# at the Toy Factory in Ludibrium Clocktower. Rocky seemed to be swamped with work due to a sudden increase in monsters destroying parts here and there. He was worried about running out of essential parts, so he asked me if I could gather up #b50 cogs#k and #b30 screws#k. .

#t4003000# #b#c4003000##k/30
#t4000115# #b#c4000115##k/50
At the Toy Factory in Ludibrium, I gave Rocky the cogs and screws needed for him to fix anything that is broken. Hopefully that was enough to undo the damages done by those pesky monsters.

string.name: name
string.value: Mac the Mechanic's Maintenance Manual
I'll need to have a word with Mac the Mechanic.

I met up with Mac the Mechanic at the Toy Factory in Ludibrium. Mac was panicking because of the fact that all the blueprints and #bMaintenance Manual#k of the factory were stolen by Toy Trojan. If I destroy the boxes around the Toy Factory, I may find a hidden path that'll lead me to a clue.
I found the documents Mac the Mechanic lost, and he seemed very much relieved by it. Something's strange, though. Why would the toy soldiers feel the need to steal this in the first place...?

string.name: name
string.value: The Missing Mechanical Parts
I better go see Cheng the Assistant, who should be somewhere around Toy Factory

At the Toy Factory in Ludibrium, I found Cheng the Assistant riding around on a white wooden horse. Chang was concerned about the sudden disappearance of the mechanic parts all over the factory, and wanted me to find those parts for him. I should head over to Toy Factory <Main Construction1> Part 4 with help from Cheng, where the parts are hidden. I need to gather up 10 Mechanical Parts and bring them back to Cheng.
I found the 10 missing parts in the Toy Factory and gave them back to Cheng the Assisntant. Hopefully this will help the Factory run as smoothly as it should be.

string.name: name
string.value: Scroll of Life

Somewhere around Ludibrium, I saw a small fairy that was glowing all over her body. Her name was Wisp, and is a part of Mar the Fairy. She saw my pet in a state of doll and claimed that she can turn my doll pet back into a real-life pet with #bwater of life#k and #bmcdonald's#k. The Scroll of Life is apparently at #bCloy's House#k in Ludibrium, which should be empty at this point.

I found the #bscroll of life#k at #bCloy's house#k in Ludibrium. I gave this, along with the #bWater of Life#k, to Wisp and he helped turn my pet back alive. I need to have some play time with my pet now!

string.name: name
string.value: Cleaning Up Helios Tower
Helios Tower opened recently for public, and apparently #p2041004# has been going through some trouble thanks to the growing number of #o3210208#s at the tower.

#p2041004#, the security guard of Ludibrium, approached me and asked for a favor. He was concerned about the growing number of #b#o3210208##k at the Helios Tower, which has recently opened for travelers. According to him, the #o3210208#s have been blocking the travelers' path, as well as destroying the elevators in the tower, and he wanted me to eliminate some #o3210208#s for him.\n\n#o3210208# #r#a32411#
With a request from #p2041004#, the security guard of Ludibrium, I went into Helios Tower and eliminated 20 #o3210208#s, the striped rats that have been destroying the elevators at the tower.

string.name: name
string.value: The Messenger of the Toy Palace 1

string.name: parent
string.value: The Messenger of the Toy Palace
#p2041004#, the security guard of #m220000000#, has something in plan for me. I should go visit #p2041004#.

I went to #m220000000# to visit #p2041004#, the security guard of #m220000000#, because he had an offer for me. #p2041004# requested that I, as a representative of the #m220000000# castle, visit a place called #m240000000#, and if I was really interested in heading there as a messenger of #m220000000#, then I should eliminate #r10 Ratz, 10 Black Ratz, and 10 Red Ratz#k first.

Retz #r#a32421##k
Black Ratz #r#a32422##k
Ratz #r#a32423##k

At the suggestion from #p2041004#, the security guard of #m220000000#, I headed to #m240000000# as the messenger of #m220000000#. #p2041004# graciously provided me with #b#t4161013##k. What's the item I'm supposed to give him, though?

string.name: name
string.value: The Messenger of the Toy Palace 2

string.name: parent
string.value: The Messenger of the Toy Palace

At the suggestion from #p2041004#, the security guard of #m220000000#, I headed to #m240000000# as the messenger of #m220000000#. #p2041004# graciously provided me with #tLeafre Guidebook# as well as a flight ticket provided by #m220000000#. What's the item I'm supposed to give him, though?

I received a request from #p2041004#, the security guard of #m220000000#, to head to a place called #m240000000# as the messenger of #m220000000#. #m240000000# is a town entrenched in Minar Forest somewhere in Ossyria, and I was told to deliver an item from #m2200000000# to the chief of the town, Tatamo. I better give that item from #p2041004# to #p2081000# of #m240000000#.\n\n#t4031347# #b#c4031347##k / 1

I managed to deliver a present from #m220000000# to the chief of Leafre, Tatamo, as their messenger. As a sign of gratitude, Tatamo gave me a magic seed that allows me to transport between Ellinia and Leafre.

string.name: name
string.value: Disgruntled Roly-Poly Worker
#p2040013# apparently has been skipping lunch these days because of heavy workload... I better check it out.

#p2040013# complained to me that he had been missing lunch lately because of the #o3210205#s that were all over Eos Tower. The angered #p2040013# wanted me to kill #b20 #o3210205#s#k and bring him #b5 #t4000096#s#k.

#i4000096##t4000096# #b#c4000096#/5#k
#o3210205# #r#a32441##k

I was able to help out #p2040013#, who had been missing lunch almost everyday because of the #o3210205#s invading Eos Tower, by killing off those #o3210205#s and giving him some walnuts in the process.

string.name: name
string.value: Spider's Out at Eos Tower
The King's #b#p2041022##k is in need of help. What must it be? I better head over to #b#m220000400##k.

#p2041022# received an order to deliver the king's royal letter to #m221000000#. The problem is, he's hesitant to go, because to go to #m221000000#, he'll have to go through Eos Tower, and is afraid of descending down the Tower because of the spiders. Oh well, I'll have to kill off #r20 #o2230103#s#k #r20 #o2230104#s#k for #p2041022#. 

#o2230103# #r#a32451##k 
#o2230104# #r#a32452##k
I was able to eliminate #o2230103# and #o2230104#. I'm sure now #p2041022# can do his job. I thought #p2041022# was unafraid of anything else in life besides the King. Spiders? That was unexpected...

string.name: name
string.value: A Mysterious Letter
#b#p2041004##k of #b#m220000000##k is concerned about a mysterious letter... what could it be?

#p2041004# said he's been concerned about a mysterious, anonymous letter sent to the king of #m220000000#, and believes something huge is developing. He then asked me to head over to #b#m100030000##k and find out who wrote the letter...

There's a huge wooden entryway leading into #m100030000# which I'd never seen before. It almost looks like an entryway to a fortress... I should try talking to #p1094000#, who was standing in front of me. I remember him telling me that a #bpirate #p1072008##k fort is being built here. I wonder who the captain is...

string.name: name
string.value: Rightful Donation Culture
I should go to #b#m220000000##k and listen in on #b#p2041022##k's problem.

#b#m220000000##k #b#p2041022##k's problem was more difficult than I imagined. It's hard enough finding a #b#t04021005##k, but to freely donate it to the king of #b#m220000000##k!? But if it's true that every great adventurer must learn to generously donate, maybe I need to consider donating as well. 
Plus, according to #b#p2041022##k, the king is a very generous person so it will probably be used to help those in need... This is stressful.

I don't know if I made the right decision, but I gave away #b#t04021005##k to #b#p2041022##k. I feel like I've somewhat wasted it but I guess it does feel good to know that I've helped someone in need. Overall, it was a good experience.

string.name: name
string.value: Operation Strategy 1 : Collect All the Eggs

string.name: parent
string.value: The Clocktower Monster Wipe-Out Operation
#b#p2041026##k in the #b#m220000000# Clocktower basement#k has proposed to begin a Clocktower Monster Wipe-Out Operation. What does he mean by that? Let's go find #p2041026#.

The Clocktower Monster Wipe-Out Operation has begun. #p2041026# asks you to bring back #b#o4230113##k, #b#o3230306##k, and #b#t4031991##k... It seems he wants to exterminate all the eggs first. Alright, whatever he wants!
He says you can find other eggs by hunting #rTick, Tick-Tock, or Chronos type monsters#k, but #b#o5220003s# have a tendency to hatch their eggs in another bird's nest#k, so their eggs would be amongst eggs of other birds. It seems you have to crack other eggs to find it and take it over to #t4031991#. 

#i2022354##t2022354# #b#c2022354#/10#k 
#i2022355##t2022355# #b#c2022355#/10#k 
#i4031991##t4031991# #b#c4031991#/10#k
You have found all the eggs and gave them to #p2041026#. Ghosthunter Bob seems satisfied and suggest you engage in the operation.

string.name: name
string.value: Operation Strategy 2 : Defeat the Monsters

string.name: parent
string.value: The Clocktower Monster Wipe-Out Operation

Operation strategy 2 is much simpler than strategy 1. It was to defeat the monsters! You must defeat #r#o4230113##k, #r#o3230306##k, #r#o4230114##k, #r#o4230115##k, and even #r#o5220003##k, so it's not child's play... but let's defeat the monsters.

#o4230113# #r#a32491##k 
#o3230306# #r#a32492##k 
#o4230114# #r#a32493##k 
#o4230115# #r#a32494##k 
#o5220003# #r#a32495##k
You have reported to #p2041026# after defeating all the monsters. It's not as easy as it may seem since there are so many types of monsters to hunt!

string.name: name
string.value: Operation Strategy 3: A Cute Baby Bird

string.name: parent
string.value: The Clocktower Monster Wipe-Out Operation

#p2041026# seems to be preoccupied with raising birds. According to the new research conducted, #o5220003#s have undergone changes under the management of Papulatus, but can make great pets when tamed. He has given you a cute baby bird, saying you can feed the bird #b#t4031992#s#k that can be obtained from the Clocktower Monsters. He has asked you to return the bird when it's fully grown.

The baby bird has become full-fledged since you've been diligently feeding the bird #t4031992#s. Although it's sad to let go of the bird to which you have grown attached, but you have no choice but to return the bird to Ghosthunter Bob. Be well, bird.

string.name: name
string.value: A Deal with the Broker

There's a new, unknown and mysterious town called #m261000000#. It's an alchemist town, which explains the mysterious aura around it... I better go see #b#p2111007##k to gain some information on #m261000000#.

When I asked #p2111007# about #m261000000#, he requested #b10,000 mesos#k for information, as if it's an accepted practice. Is he really a broker...? Come to think of it, #p2111007#'s reputation isn't that great either...what do I have to lose?

After giving #p2111007# 10,000 mesos, I was able to obtain some information on #m261000000#. A long time ago, after the death of the Black Magician, the alchemists came together and set up a town called #m261000000#. Nowadays, the town is split into #b2 societies, Zenumist and Alcadno. They seem to be in constant conflict with one another.#k

string.name: name
string.value: Test from the Head of Zenumist Society

string.name: parent
string.value: Joining Zenumist

Bourne of a true union of science and magic... #bZenumist, is a society of pure alchemy#k. With the conflict raging in #m261000000#, however, Zenumist doesn't seem to accept outsiders. I really want to join them, though... I better go see #b#p2111007##k.

#p2111007# told me in order to join Zenumist, I'll have to run the rigorous test of showing my lab results to the president of the Zenumist Society. But he also said if I can get him #b2 ores of jewels, regardless of type#k, then he'd take care of the rest...
After giving #p2111007# 2 ores, he told me to wait. I hope I get in!

string.name: name
string.value: Zenumist Cape

string.name: parent
string.value: Joining Zenumist

After visiting the Broker once more, he gave me a bottle that contained some strange-looking water. He then told me to take it to #bZenumist Society#k, and place it next to the blue alchemy pillar, which will automatically create the item for me. He then told me to give it to #b#p2111000##k... is the broker really telling the truth? Seems impossible...

When I left #t4031705# next to the alchemy pillar, I heard a deafening explosion, followed by the creation of a useless tree branch. I had no idea what that was, but I gave it to #p2111000#. He seemed VERY satisfied with the result, and gave me #b#t1102135##k in return. Why would he want a tree branch?

string.name: name
string.value: Test from the Head of Alcadno Society

string.name: parent
string.value: Joining Alcadno

A true union of alchemy and mechanical engineering, #bAlcadno, is a society that celebrates new alchemy#k. With the conflict raging in #m261000000#, however, Alcadno doesn't seem to accept others. I really want to join Alcadno, though... I better go talk to #b#p2111007##k.

#p2111007# told me in order to join the Alcadno Society, I'll have to compile a series of lab reports and present it. He said he could obtain a legitimate report if I pay him #b2 ores, regardless of type#k. He'd then take care of the rest...
After giving #p2111007# 2 ores of jewels, he told me to wait.

string.name: name
string.value: Alcadno Cape

string.name: parent
string.value: Joining Alcadno

I received #t4031704# from the broker. I was told to give it to #p2111001# and answer the questions in the order that the broker told me in order to become a member of Alcadno... I better remember the sequences that #p2111007# gave me when I go see #p2111001#.

After a number of tough, tough questions, #p2111001# finally accepted me as a member of Alcadno. Flashing his trademark glass eye as he gave me #t1102136#, the head of the Alcadno Society may look intimidating, but he's a really nice person.

string.name: name
string.value: Re-acquiring Zenumist Cape
I lost #t1102135#. Without it, I can't prove that I'm Zenumist. What should I do? I better go talk to the president of the Zenumist Society, #b#p2111000##k.

#p2111000# gave me that look of disappointment as he asked me to bring the items required to make another #t1102135#. Those items are #b#t4000021##k and #b#t4021003##k, with #b10,000 mesos#k. Thank goodness I can make another one. 

#i4000021##t4000021# #b#c4000021##k/10 
#i4021003##t4021003# #b#c4021003##k/5
I got #t1102135# again. Without it, I can't be accepted as a Zenumist. I better not lose it again.

string.name: name
string.value: Re-acquiring Alcadno Cape
Oh no...! I lost #t1102136#, the one item that proves that I'm a member of Alcadno. What should I do? I better go talk to the president of the Alcadno Society, #p2111001#.

#p2111001# told me he could give me another cape, but this time, I'll have to come up with all the items required to make the cape. As long as I can get another one, gathering the items is not a problem! Those items are #b#t4000021##k and #b#t4021006##k, with #b10,000 mesos#k.

#i4000021##t4000021# #b#c4000021##k/10 
#i4021006##t4021006# #b#c4021006##k/5
I got Alcadno Cape again. Without it, I can't be accepted as an Alcadno. I better not lose it again.

string.name: name
string.value: Helping Out Bedin
#b#p2111008##k, an alchemist from Zenumist, seems to be looking for help with his experiment...

#p2111008# told me he was short on some items for his experiment and asked me to get #b5 refined #t4010004#s#k and #b50 #t4000352#s#k for him.

#i4010004##t4010004# #b#c4010004##k/5 
#i4000352##t4000352# #b#c4000352##k/50
I gave #p2111008# #t4011004# and #t4000352#. This #t4011004# seems to have a peculiar power of registering spells into it. I learned something new today.

string.name: name
string.value: Getting in the Way of Alcadno
#b#p2111008##k, an alchemist from Zenumist, seems to have a plan in store. Now that I'm Zenumist, I should help him out, right? I better go see #p2111008# immediately.

Zenumist is in conflict with Alcadno... I knew that fact, but I never thought he'd ask me for a favor like this! Anyway, since #p2111008# made the request, I better follow through with it, or I may be in trouble. I'll have to destroy #r200 #o5110300#k that Alcadnos have been working on. \n\n#o5110300# #r#a33081#
I destroyed the #o5110300#s that Alcadnos have been working on, at the request of #p2111008#. Hmmm... was I allowed to do this? Why do Zenumist and Alcadno have such a huge conflict between them?

string.name: name
string.value: An Incident, and the Missing Alchemist
#b#p2111008##k, the alchemist from Zenumist, seems to be needing me for something else. What must it be this time? I better go see #p2111008#.

Bedin told me to enter the lab of Alcadno when no one is present, and steal the #b#t4031708##k for him. Apparently, it can be found on top of the table at #b#m261020700##k... but in order to get to #m261020700#, I'll have to use the portal from #m261020600#. Since all the lights are off at the lab, I'll have to really search for the document in the dark... \n\n#i4031708##t4031708# #b#c4031708##k/1

An incident from long ago. It all started with a flawed experiment from an alchemist. The failure brought a massive explosion, and the accompanying earthquake destroyed many parts of Magatia. The Magic Pentagram that was destroyed then has made Homun in rage ever since. To make matters worse, the alchemist responsible for this seems to have gone missing...

string.name: name
string.value: Carson's Experiment

string.name: parent
string.value: Zenumist and the Missing Alchemist

I found out through Bedin about the incident that happened a long time ago, and there are two ple that hold the final clues. One is the missing alchemist himself, the other is the president of the society! Seems like he knows something about the missing alchemist...

Carson told me if I wanted to know more about the incident, then I'll have to prove him my worth, by entering the #bclosed-off lab#k where #rHomun#k is, and acquire the Magic Control Device and control the monsters through that. Once I throw the device into the Pentagram of Alchemy in the lab, the monsters can be controlled in an instant, and then I'll need to bring back #b#t4031709##k as evidence... \n\n#i4031709##t4031709# #b#c4031709##k/1
After I told him I successfully controlled Homunclu, that's when the president started discussing serious matters with me.

string.name: parent
string.value: Zenumist and the Missing Alchemist
#p2111000# asked me to search Dr. De Lang's house, and if I find any information inside, I have to report it to him. I better head off to the missing alchemist's house.

There were some writings found at the missing alchemist's house, but nothing seems significant. It did mention a pendant multiple times, though... a pendant? What does that have to do with his studies?

string.name: name
string.value: Russellon's Items for Experiment
#p2111009#, the alchemist for Alcadno, seems to be in need of something for his experiment. I better go visit #b#p2111009##k.

#p2111009#, an alchemist who works on fighting diseases, asked me to get #b#t4031694##k for him, a crucial ingredient for his medicine. #t4031694# can be found through #o3110302#, and I better take note of the advice that getting it from #o3110303# is much easier than through #o3110302#.\n\n#i4031694##t4031694# #b#c4031694##k/10
Once I gave him all the #t4031694#s, #p2111009# seemed ecstatic and started working on his experiment. ...What kind of a medicine would that be?

string.name: name
string.value: Destroy the Roid

#b#p2111009##k, an alchemist from #m261000000#, seems to be proficient at concocting and experimenting with medicine. He mentioned that he's short on something again. What would he be short on this time? I better go see #p2111009#.

Out of the blue, #p2111009# asked me to destroy #r#o5110301##k, which can be found at the storage area in the basement. Destroying #o5110301# wouldn't be impossible... but why? Does this have something to do with getting in the way of the Zenumist Society? \n\n#o5110301# #r#a33131##k
After destroying the #o5110301#s, I reported the results to #p2111009#. He then flashed a smile of satisfaction and relief. What the...something about this creeps me out!

string.name: name
string.value: Life Alchemy, and the Missing Alchemist

Out of the blue, Alcadno's #p2111009# told me he wanted to reward me for helping him out with various favors... something doesn't seem right, but I'll just think of it as a positive event. I should go see #b#p2111009##k.

#p2111009# seemed grateful that I've helped him, and asked me to take a pill that he left for me at the top of the table in the upper lab. He also asked me to come down and see him again before the effect wears off. What is this, is he conducting an experiment on me?

I knew it! I knew the medicine was dangerous. Fortunately, I was able to receive an antidote, but this is crazy! According to Russellon, the experiment he conducted was something he did with the #bmissing alchemist#k, a friend of his. The missing alchemist must have worked on something like changing the human's body form...

string.name: name
string.value: Maed's Experiment

string.name: parent
string.value: Alcadno and the Missing Alchemist

The missing alchemist from Alcadno who caused that terrible explosion... He must have done some significant research and experiments. The only person that is still aware of his work seems to be the president of Alcadno, #bMaed#k...
#p2111001#, the head of Alcadno Society, told me if I wanted to know more about the missing alchemist, then I'll have to prove him my worth by destroying #r#o7110301##k.\n\n#o7110301# #r#a33151##k
